evs.data.fileio
Class PairedFileIO

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.FileIO
      evs.data.fileio.PairedFileIO

public class PairedFileIO
extends FileIO

Reads and writes paired data files in XML format and generates a paired dataset from an analysis unit containing an appropriate file data source.

Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

read

public static PairedData read(java.io.File pairedFile,
                              IOState ioState,
                              double nV)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Reads a file containing paired data and returns a paired dataset. Eliminates duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the pairedFile
ioState - the I/O state
nV - the null value
Returns:
a paired dataset
Throws:
java.io.IOException

public static PairedData read(java.io.File pairedFile,
                              IOState ioState,
                              boolean eliminateDuplicates,
                              double nV)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Reads a file containing paired data and returns a paired dataset. Specify whether to eliminate duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the pairedFile
ioState - the I/O state
eliminateDuplicates - is true to eliminate duplicate pairs
nV - the null value
Returns:
a paired dataset
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readRawPairs

public static DoubleMatrix2D readRawPairs(java.io.File pairedFile,
                                          IOState ioState,
                                          double nV)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
Reads a file containing paired data and returns a matrix of double values. This method is useful for reading paired data that contains multiple forecasts with the same valid time and lead time, which is not allowed for a regular paired dataset (e.g. if pooling across several locations).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the pairedFile
ioState - the I/O state
nV - the null value
Returns:
a paired dataset
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readText

public static PairedData readText(java.io.File pairedFile,
                                  java.lang.String valDelims,
                                  double nV)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Reads a text file containing paired data where each row contains the forecast date (month, day, year, hour), lead time, observation and ensemble members. Assumes UTC time. Eliminates duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the paired file to read
valDelims - the data value delimiter(s)
nV - the null value
Returns:
the paired data set
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readText

public static PairedData readText(java.io.File pairedFile,
                                  java.lang.String valDelims,
                                  java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                  boolean removeDuplicates,
                                  int skipRows,
                                  double nV)
                           throws java.io.IOException
Reads a text file containing paired data where each row contains the forecast date (month, day, year, hour), lead time, observation and ensemble members.

Parameters:
pairedFile - the paired file to read
valDelims - the data value delimiter(s)
removeDuplicates - is true to remove duplicates
timeZone - the time zone
skipRows - the number of rows to skip in the header
nV - the null value
Returns:
the paired data set
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readASCIIPairs

public static PairedData readASCIIPairs(java.io.File pairedFile,
                                        java.lang.String valDelims,
                                        java.util.TimeZone timeZone,
                                        boolean eliminateDuplicates,
                                        int skipRows,
                                        double nV)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
Reads a text file containing paired data where each row contains the forecast date (month, day, year, hour), lead time, observation and ensemble members. Specify whether to eliminate duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time). Currently reads ASCII with a fixed date format. TODO: update to support date formats specified by the ASCII format variable in this class.

Parameters:
pairedFile - the paired file to read
valDelims - the data value delimiter(s)
timeZone - the time zone
eliminateDuplicates - is true to eliminate duplicate pairs
skipRows - an optional number of rows to skip in the header
nV - the null value
Returns:
the paired data set
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                         boolean stripNulls,

stripNulls - is true to strip null values, false otherwise
precision - the number of decimal places (>=1) for writing pairs

writeASCIIPairs

public static void writeASCIIPairs(PairedData pairs,
                                   java.io.File output,
                                   java.lang.String sep)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Writes a flat text format file from a paired dataset where each row comprises the forecast date and time, the forecast lead time, the observation, and the ensemble members.

Parameters:
pairs - the paired data
output - the output file
sep - the separator string
Throws:
java.io.IOException

readPairedFileWriteASCII

public static void readPairedFileWriteASCII(java.io.File pairedFile,
                                            java.io.File output,
                                            IOState ioState,
                                            java.lang.String sep,
                                            double nV)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Reads a paired data file and converts the output to a flat text format where each row comprises the forecast date and time, the forecast lead time, the observation, and the ensemble members. Eliminates duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the paired file
ioState - the I/O state
output - the output file
sep - the separator string
nV - the null value
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                                            java.io.File output,
                                            IOState ioState,
                                            java.lang.String sep,
                                            boolean eliminateDuplicates,
                                            double nV)
                                     throws java.io.IOException
Reads a paired data file and converts the output to a flat text format where each row comprises the forecast date and time, the forecast lead time, the observation, and the ensemble members. Specify whether to eliminate duplicate pairs (same forecast valid time and lead time).

Parameters:
pairedFile - the paired file
ioState - the I/O state
output - the output file
sep - the separator string
eliminateDuplicates - is true to eliminate duplicate pairs
nV - the null value
